text: I am one for whom it is right for whom it is appropriate to say nothing but the truth about God a variant reading for ‘alā has ‘alayya ‘for me’ in which case haqīqun ‘it is right’ is the subject of the sentence its predicate being an ‘that’ and what follows it sc. ‘I say nothing but the truth about God’. Truly I have come to you with a clear proof from your Lord. So send forth with me to Syria the Children of Israel’ he Pharaoh had enslaved them.
